comments:
Build:  TPTP-4.3.0-200609220100

- Drop down the profile launch configuration and select profile
- Create a launch configuration of type "External Java Application"
- Switch to the main tab and click on browse.  Select the class file that has been attached to this defect.
- Select the main page and only select "Execution Time Analysis"
- Click on profile
- Press on enter twice in the console to terminate the application

Open the execution stat view.  Switch to the call tree page and attempt to expand the main thread.  The following exception is logged in the workspace log file:

java.lang.ClassCastException

This maybe because the call tree is not available in the compressed execution mode, but this will confuse the user when they attempt to expand a thread.

We need to exclude pages that don't have any content when a set of options are selected.

Created an attachment (id=50908)
Here's the proposed fix

Hide call tree and method invocation tabs when invocation info is not avaliable.

Ali,
  Did you get a chance to apply this patch and test?

Thanks

Guru/Pavel,

This patch works fine but you might want to also disable/remove the context menu item "Show Method Invocation" when the user right clicks a method.  This item should only be visible/enabled when running in uncompressed mode.

Pavel,

Can you also modify the default option of the "Execution Time Analysis" so that "Show execution flow graphical details" is selected by default.  It would be a shame for a novice user to think that we don't have some of the added values when this option is selected (e.g. call tree/uml diagrams/method invocation/etc...)

Thanks.

I was unable to apply the patch. I do not have access to any of the trace files.
Will request Eugene to do so.
